page.title: 03FIRST HOLY COMMUNION DAY (1)
page.content: On Sunday, 26th May, 1985 Classes 4,5 and 6 were confirmed by Bishop Wheeler of the Leeds Diocese at Holy Spirit R.C. Church. There were about eighty children confirmed. We had our photographs taken by the Heckmondwike Reporter and the Heckmondwike Herald. The church was full. Some chairs had to be put out and there were a lot of people at the back of the church and the choir loft was packed out. Some people had to park their cars down High Street. I woke up at 6.45 a.m. I had my rice crispies and toast for breakfast. Then my Mum gave me a box of chocolates, a bookmarker and a statue of the Sacred Heart. Then I watched 'Are You Awake Yet?' -a childrens programme on I.T.V. I got ready. My Mum ironed my tie. I washed and then I got dressed.
